most_visited_india.name: Shimla
most_visited_india.description: Picturesque hill station known for its colonial architecture, scenic landscapes, and pleasant climate.

most_visited_india.name: Goa
most_visited_india.description: A popular beach destination, Goa is known for its vibrant nightlife, scenic beaches, and Portuguese-influenced architecture.

most_visited_india.name: Jaipur
most_visited_india.description: Known as the Pink City, Jaipur is famous for its stunning forts, palaces, and vibrant markets.

most_visited_india.name: Varanasi
most_visited_india.description: One of the oldest cities in the world, Varanasi is a spiritual hub located on the banks of the Ganges.

most_visited_india.name: Kerala Backwaters
most_visited_india.description: A tranquil network of lagoons and lakes, Kerala Backwaters are famous for houseboat cruises and lush landscapes.

most_visited_india.name: Lahaul & Spiti
most_visited_india.description: A remote and scenic area in the Himalayas, Lahaul & Spiti offers breathtaking landscapes and Buddhist monasteries.

most_visited_india.name: Mysore
most_visited_india.description: Mysore is renowned for its royal heritage, with landmarks like Mysore Palace and the annual Dussehra festival.

most_visited_india.name: Leh-Ladakh
most_visited_india.description: A high-altitude desert, Leh-Ladakh is known for its stark landscapes, Buddhist monasteries, and adventurous trekking routes.
